intro: Lycopodium × sabinifolium var. superfertile, commonly known as the fertile larch fern, is a hybrid fern species that exhibits unique botanical characteristics. It is a member of the Lycopodiaceae family and is notable for its high fertility, which is reflected in its name "superfertile." The plant features upright, branched stems covered in small, scale-like leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in temperate regions. Its reproductive structures, including sporangia, are well-developed, contributing to its success in natural habitats.
